00039 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK     1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00040 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK        (1000000000UL/HZ)
00041 
00042 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ   16384
00043 
00044 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00045 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00046 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00048 struct xnthread;
00049 struct task_struct;
00050 
00051 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00052 
00053     /* Kernel mode side */
00054 
00055 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00056     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00057        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00058     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00059     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00060     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00061     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00062        - NULL for RT K threads,
00063        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00064        - current for RT US threads.
00065     */
00066 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00067 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00068 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00069 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00070 
00071     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00072     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00073     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00074     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00075 
00076     /* User mode side */
00077     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00078     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00079 
00080     /* Init block */
00081     struct xnthread *self;
00082     int imask;
00083     const char *name;
00084     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00085     void *cookie;
00086 
00087 } xnarchtcb_t;
00088 
00089 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00090 
00091     unsigned exception;
00092     struct pt_regs *regs;
00093 
00094 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00095 
00096 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((unsigned int)(fi)->regs->trap)
00097 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->regs->dar)
00098 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00099 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00100 /* FIXME: FPU faults ignored by the nanokernel on PPC. */
00101 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  (0)
00102 
00103 /* The following predicates are only usable over a regular Linux stack
00104  *    context. */
00105 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_ACCESS_TRAP)
00106 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00107                                 ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_IABR_TRAP || \
00108                                 (fi)->exception == ADEOS_SSTEP_TRAP || \
00109                                 (fi)->exception == ADEOS_PERFMON_TRAP))
00110 
00111 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi))

00117 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00118 
00119 {
00120 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00121     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00122         return vmalloc(bytes);
00123 #endif
00124 
00125     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00126 }
00127 
00128 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00129 
00130 {
00131 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00132     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00133         vfree(chunk);
00134     else
00135 #endif
00136         kfree(chunk);
00137 }

00139 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00140 
00141 {
00142     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00143 }

00151 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00152                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00153 {
00154     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00157 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00158 
00159 {
00160     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00161 
00162     rthal_load_cpuid();
00163 
00164     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00165        and always inside a critical section. */
00166     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00167     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00168     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00169 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00170     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00171     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00172     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00173                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00174                     : NULL);
00175 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00176 }
00177 
00178 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00179     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00180 }
00181 
00182 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00183                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00184 {
00185     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00186     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00187 
00188     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00189 
00190     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00191         {
00192         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00193 
00194         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00195 
00196 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00197         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00198            they don't work properly in our context. */
00199         if (cur_cpu_spec->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00200             asm volatile (
00201                 "dssall;\n"
00202                 : : );
00203         }
00204 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00205 
00206         if (!cpu_isset(smp_processor_id(), mm->cpu_vm_mask)) {
00207                 cpu_set(smp_processor_id(), mm->cpu_vm_mask);
00208         }
00209         
00210         if (cur_cpu_spec->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_SLB) {
00211                 switch_slb(next, mm);
00212         }
00213         else {
00214                 switch_stab(next, mm);
00215         }
00216         
00217         flush_tlb_pending();
00218         
00219         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00220 
00221         barrier();
00222         }
00223     else
00224         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00225         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00226 }
00227 
00228 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00229                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00230 {
00231     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00232 }
00233 
00234 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00235 
00236 {
00237     /* Empty */
00238 }
00239 
00240 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00241                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00242                                          const char *name)
00243 {
00244     tcb->user_task = current;
00245     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00246     tcb->ksp = 0;
00247     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00248 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00249     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00250     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00251 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00252     tcb->entry = NULL;
00253     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00254     tcb->self = thread;
00255     tcb->imask = 0;
00256     tcb->name = name;
00257 }
00258 
00259 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00260 
00261 {
00262     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00263     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00264     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00265     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00266 }
00267 
00268 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00269                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00270                                        void *cookie,
00271                                        int imask,
00272                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00273                                        char *name)
00274 {
00275     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00276 
00277     rthal_local_irq_flags_hw(flags);
00278 
00279     if (tcb->stackbase) {
00280         *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00281         
00282         ksp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 16) & ~0xf);
00283         *ksp = 0L; /* first stack frame back-chain */
00284         ksp = ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD; /* first stack frame (entry uses) */
00285         *ksp = (unsigned long)ksp+STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD; /* second back-chain */
00286         ksp = ksp - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE; /* domain context */
00287         tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00288         *((unsigned long *)tcb->ksp) = (unsigned long)ksp + 224; /*back-chain*/
00289         /* NOTE: these depend on rthal_switch_context ordering */
00290         ksp[18] = (unsigned long)get_paca(); /* r13 needs to hold paca */
00291         ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00292         ksp[20] = ((unsigned long *)&xnarch_thread_trampoline)[1]; /* r2 = TOC base */
00293         ksp[25] = ((unsigned long *)&xnarch_thread_trampoline)[0]; /* lr = entry addr. */
00294         ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00295     }
00296     else {
00297         printk("xnarch_init_thread: NULL stackbase!\n");
00298     }
00299 
00300     tcb->entry = entry;
00301     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00302     tcb->self = thread;
00303     tcb->imask = imask;
00304     tcb->name = name;
00305 }
00306 
00307 /* No lazy FPU init on PPC. */
00308 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) (1)
00309 
00310 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00311 
00312 {
00313 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00314     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00315         rthal_enable_fpu();
00316 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00317 }
00318 
00319 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00320 
00321 {
00322 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00323     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00324        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00325     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00326     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00327 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00328 }
00329 
00330 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00331 
00332 {
00333 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00334 
00335     if(tcb->fpup)
00336         {
00337         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00338 
00339         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00340             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00341         }   
00342 
00343 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00344 }
00345 
00346 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00347 
00348 {
00349 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00350 
00351     if(tcb->fpup)
00352         {
00353         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00354 
00355         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00356             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00357         }   
00358 
00359     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when Xenomai preempted Linux,
00360        whereas we could be much lazier. */
00361     if(tcb->user_task)
00362         rthal_disable_fpu();
00363 
00364 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00365 }
00366 
00367 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00368 
00369 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00370 
00371 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00372 
00373     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00374     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00375     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00376 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00377     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00378     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00379 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00380     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00381 }
00382 
00383 #define xnarch_alloc_stack(tcb,stacksize) \
00384 ({ \
00385     int __err; \
00386     (tcb)->stacksize = stacksize; \
00387     if (stacksize == 0) { \
00388         (tcb)->stackbase = NULL; \
00389         __err = 0; \
00390     } else { \
00391         (tcb)->stackbase = xnmalloc(stacksize); \
00392         __err = (tcb)->stackbase ? 0 : -ENOMEM; \
00393     } \
00394     __err; \
00395 })
00396 
00397 #define xnarch_free_stack(tcb) \
00398 do { \
00399       if ((tcb)->stackbase) \
00400           xnfree((tcb)->stackbase); \
00401 } while(0)
00402 
00403 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00404 
00405 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00406 
00407 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00408                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00409                                            const char *name)
00410 {
00411     struct task_struct *task = current;
00412 
00413     tcb->user_task = task;
00414     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00415     tcb->ksp = 0;
00416     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00417 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00418     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00419     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00420 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00421     tcb->entry = NULL;
00422     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00423     tcb->self = thread;
00424     tcb->imask = 0;
00425     tcb->name = name;
00426 }
00427 
00428 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00429 
00430 {
00431     unsigned irq;
00432 
00433     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00434         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00435                              irq,
00436                              handler,
00437                              NULL,
00438                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00439 
00440     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00441        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00442        individually. */
00443 
00444     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00445                          RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ,
00446                          handler,
00447                          NULL,
00448                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00449 }
00450 
00451 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00452 
00453 {
00454     unsigned irq;
00455 
00456     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00457         {
00458         switch (irq)
00459             {
00460 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00461             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00462 
00463                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00464                 continue;
00465 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00466 
00467             default:
00468 
00469                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00470             }
00471         }
00472 
00473     rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00474 }
00475 
00476 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00477 
00478 {
00479     unsigned irq;
00480 
00481     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00482         {
00483         switch (irq)
00484             {
00485 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00486             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00487 
00488                 continue;
00489 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00490 
00491             default:
00492 
00493                 rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,irq);
00494             }
00495         }
00496 
00497     rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00498 }
00499 
00500 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00501 
00502 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00503 
00504 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00505     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00506        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00507        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00508        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00509        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00510        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00511     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00512 }
00513 
00514 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00515     rthal_timer_release();
00516 }
00517 
00518 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00519 
00520 {
00521 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00522     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00523 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00524     return 0;
00525 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00526 }
00527 
00528 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00529 
00530 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00531 
00532 #include <linux/init.h>
00533 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00534 
00535 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00536 
00537 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00538 
00539 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00540 
00541 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00542 
00543 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00544 
00545 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00546 
00547 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00548 {
00549     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00550     fltinfo.exception = event;
00551     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00552     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00553 }
00554 
00555 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00556 
00557 {
00558 #if CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00559     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00560 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00561     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00562        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00563     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00564 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00565 }
00566 
00567 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00568 
00569 {
00570     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00571 
00572     if (!nktimerlat)
00573         return -ENODEV;
00574 
00575     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00576 
00577     return 0;
00578 }
00579 
00580 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00581 
00582 {
00583     int err;
00584 
00585 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00586     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00587        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00588     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00589 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00590 
00591     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00592 
00593     if (err)
00594         return err;
00595 
00596     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00597 
00598     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00599         return -ENOSYS;
00600 
00601     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00602                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00603                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00604                          NULL,
00605                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00606 
00607     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00608 
00609 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00610     err = xnshadow_mount();
00611 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00612 
00613     if (err)
00614         {
00615         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00616         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00617         }
00618 
00619     return err;
00620 }
00621 
00622 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00623 
00624 {
00625 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00626     xnshadow_cleanup();
00627 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00628     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00629     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00630 }
00631 
00632 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
